review_title: Great Part Time Job Working with Students
job_title: Academic Engagement Partner in Madison, WI
pros: Tutoring is working with motivated students, supportive administration, nice study space
cons: This position is mostly offered as part time with minimal benefits, but they make the benefits and pay range clear from outset

pros: Great company culture, professional development is encouraged
cons: lots of staff turnover, inequities between managers who work remote while expecting support staff to maintain 100% of office hours.

review_title: Great Educational Environment — But the Bloat is Real
pros: - Flexible, positive work environment - The people are great and from all walks of life - No work in the summer! (Could be a con for some but it's a pro for me) - Great support systems in place like CETL
cons: - Pay is not great for the amount of involved. You either have to put in the work and accept the low pay or run your classes in a way that involves minimal effort, thereby lowering the quality of education for students. - Admin bloat is a huge issue. Many departments have more admin than faculty. - Budget burdens are being placed directly on the shoulders of full-time instructors. They have to pick up even more classes to save the org money. These are the last people who should be affected by budget issues.

pros: Great college. Awesome staff. Opportunity to learn.
cons: Mismanaged department. No opportunity for growth or advancement.

job_title: Senior Administrative Coordinator in Madison, WI
pros: Good benefits and time off policies
cons: Slow to update and modernize with new technology

pros: The college provides many opportunities to students in the form of student work, which is extremely helpful and convenient, having a workplace right at your place of education.
cons: different departments have different levels of strictness when it comes to logging hours, ei one department manager might warn employees of not to go over hours schedule, while another manager will allow the extra 15 and 30 minutes here and there that was worked.

review_title: Good job - just wish it were more secure
pros: Motivated students, helpful colleagues, good facilities.
cons: No job security as it’s all enrollment dependent,

pros: Great Benefits, PTO, and pay. Great atmosphere
cons: Hr position are hard to come by

pros: Flexible hours, good if you are going to school there
cons: Caps on the number of hours

pros: Caring work environment. Dedicated to students. Less hierarchical than UW-Madison. Felt like you could make a meaningful impact
cons: There was little opportunity for advancement. Poor benefits if part-time employee. Most offices are internal cubicles with no natural light

pros:
Schedule Flexibility
School work
Related to my field
cons: I don't see any cons in this position.

pros: Great coworkers, people do want you to do well in your job
cons: Sometimes lack of support from higher ups

review_title: Simultaneously great, rewarding, difficult and sometimes maddening.
pros: Rewarding experience educating students who come from a wide spectrum of social and economic backgrounds.
cons: The bureaucracy of a large institution and the cheerleader mentality of the complacent administration, is a true challenge.

job_title: Academic Program Director in Madison, WI
pros: Independent work most of the time, great students, good facilities
cons:
Lack of leadership
Unreal work load

review_title: Mission is great. Upper management is blind.
pros: Good wages and benefits. Some people are really great. Nice to work with students. Mission of the college makes you feel like you make a difference.
cons: Bullying is allowed. HR and college leaders let it happen and don't care. You can report how you are treated to HR, your manager and upper leaders and they do nothing. One person is allowed to ruin a whole department and drive people away. Feels like no one cares - - not even president or vice presidents.

pros: benefits, conditions, coworkers, location, that's it
cons: there isn't too many cons

job_title: Front Desk Student Worker in Madison, WI
pros: Can do hw on the job
cons: Hours limited to 20 a week

pros:
The pay was great and enjoyed working with students.  
Enjoyed working on Blackboard and all the programs to enhance learning for students.  
Career Counselors at the main campus were great to work with.
cons:
Equipment failure was happening too often.
Not enough equipment for all classes needing same equipment on and off campus.
Too many Instructors, who sat around doing nothing or on their phones while a lecture was going on. 
Instructors who did not know the curriculum, procedures, or how to demonstrate and operate standard equipment because they didn't prepare for the class.

job_title: IT Field Technician in Madison, WI
pros: My time working at MATC has been really great. I have learned a lot from my co-workers and the people that work here are very nice and caring.
cons: I can't list any cons.

job_title: Student Support Advisor in Madison, WI
pros: Collaboration among administration, faculty, and staff in common goal of student success.
cons: No cons in my experience.

pros: Salary, benefits, parking, newer building
cons: Office is shared with 20 people, administrators very micromanage mentality but act like you can be independent. Quick to make incorrect assumptions before having a conversation. Don’t care what your interests are, only what is needed at that time .

pros: Completely virtual and great management.
cons: There are no cons to report.

review_title: Great place to work and teach
pros: Strong team mentality and cooperation.
cons: Burnout and working with the general public.

pros: Nice facilities, treats employees well
cons: I don't know any cons

pros: Lots of opportunity for paid professional development, good benefits, competitive entry level pay, positive impact on community
cons: Huge organization can be overwhelming

job_title: IT Student Worker in Madison, WI
pros: Helping other students gave me a chance to improve my software developing and communication skills. They worked around class schedule. Down time was able to be used for class or personal use.
cons: The college provides tutors for a variety of areas of study but not for IT, so other students came to us looking for tutoring-style help, but we weren't able to provide it.

pros: It is a relaxed job with flexible hours. You help anyone that asks in the Student Achievement Center (study hall). I got the job, because it is on campus, and I took the bus. Often, I was working on homework myself about half of the time.
cons: Low pay. Only $10.50 per hour. Sometimes you get people that expect you to do everything for them, but we are supposed to guide them into helping themselves.

review_title: Work-study is a great job for students
job_title: Peer Support Specialist in Madison, WI
pros: Scheduling is flexible, managers are understanding, and it's way easier having a job on campus that you can literally just walk to in three minutes than it is to have to leave for another location entirely.
cons: Some other student workers don't take their jobs very seriously. More than once I had to leave the front desk with no replacement because I had class and the person on the schedule hadn't bothered to show up.

pros: If you show initiative, you can develop your skills and take on a variety of opportunities.
cons: Leaders don't practice what they preach. Favoritism and less than transparent org changes occur regularly.

job_title: President/Chief Executive Officer in Madison, WI
pros: Student-centered; Focused on inclusion and equity
cons: 90% Revenue dependent on State Funding

pros: have been working as a work study at Madison College for about a year, great staff, great training
cons: Only able to work 20 hrs per week

pros:
- Easy money
- Great Benefits
- Not bad hours
cons: - A lot of kids are really dumb

pros: Good pay and benefits, good people
cons: Slow to change; can be too "business" focused

pros: Decent pay, supportive colleagues, decent support.
cons: No job security, no benefits.

pros: Student support and success work. Home and work balance is supportive
cons: Continuous budget cuts which limits innovation

review_title: Good as Temporary Position; No Possibility for Advancement
job_title: Adjunct English Instructor in Madison, WI
pros:
-Professional and respectful colleagues and work atmosphere
-Autonomy in teaching
-Students are a mixed bag but overall are interested in coursework and a pleasure to teach
-Professional development opportunities including paid department meetings (about $30/hr)
cons:
-The pay is a little above national standard for adjunct salaries but is not a living wage (about $2700/3-unit class/semester, limit for part-time instructors is 3 classes).
-Enormous workload.
-Large class sizes. Very little choice or knowledge over which classes you will teach next semester and what schedule you will have
-Little to no possibilities for upward mobility, to advance as full-time position with benefits. Little possibility for summer employment. Colleagues are hardworking but there is a lot of resentment regarding unfairness of part/full-time faculty. (Full-time faculty pay is 3x part-time for same work).

pros: Interesting Coworkers and opportunities to learn
cons: Poor pay and lack of opportunities for advancement.

pros: great leadership, growth potential and more
cons: movement from part time to full time is difficult

review_title: If you don't mind being contingent labor, this is a great place to work.
pros:
Well-supported professional development opportunities.

Compensation is provided for departmental events (per union contract).

Strong PT union.

Motivated students.

Certification system ensures quality PT faculty are hired, so peer faculty are usually very competent.
cons:
No opportunity for advancement.

Little respect for PT faculty among most senior management (not true at departmental levels).

Enormous pay differential (over 500%) between PT and FT faculty for the same level of experience and qualifications.  This is about the same as the PT/FT differential among all CCs, but MATC places a very high standard on their PT faculty (which is good), without appropriate compensation (not so good).

pros: This was my first graphic design job as a student. This jobg was a good stepping stone into bigger challenges. Simple projects like posters, presentations, web graphics and social media. It helped me learn to work with parameters and expectations in areas that I felt comfortable. It also gives you freedom to experiment and develop your own style and strengths.
cons: The work can become predictable. While that can be good for a new designer I started to sink into a rut. There were a couple bigger projects like the graduation materials and billboards but I was wanting more.

pros:
Some upper management really cares about students and employees.
Great network of people to find correct answer if questions arise. 
Networking is great if you are interested in getting into different departments.
Pay is fair.
Cafeteria, clinic, bank all in one place.
cons:
Unfortunately many in management only care about adding to their resume and not if the policies they are implementing are a benefit to students. 
Watch your back because ladder climbers will stab in the back in a second.
Parking is a 6th circle of hell.

pros: It's a good place to continue your career in education. They seem to be up to date on lots of technology, and place a lot of emphasis on good interaction with management. There's also a lot of emphasis on all the students getting through the classes.
cons: The technology they do have seems to take forever to become enabled. It seems that to get help you have to be "in the know" to get whatever you need to done. They seem to be unorganized with staff hiring and HR.

review_title: Great sense of community and opportunity to do meaningful work.
pros: Interesting and varied projects and people, excellent mission, made great friends, can see and feel positive impact of education and services on students and alumni.
cons: Like anywhere, new leadership can change and challenge what you like about your role and work environment. Much of course depends on the experience, ethics and personality of the immediate supervisor, so experience can vary widely.

job_title: Part-time Instructor Information Technology in Madison, WI
pros:
- Relaxed environment which promotes student learning.
- Instructors are well compensated
- There is curriculum available to use for courses, and the instructor has the freedom to make necessary modifications for his/her particular course.
- Instructors attend courses which improve their teaching skills.
cons: - For part time instructors who work in other full time jobs, it can be challenging to keep up with changes, both technological and logistical, happening at the college.

pros: Pay is above average, government benefits and a sense of community.  Get to interact with students who are trying to make an impact on the world.
cons: Typical government bureaucracy in which little moves at more than the pace of a snail.  There was a lot of animosity between the administration and the faculty.

pros: The people are overall hard working and incredibly dedicated to student success. There is no shortage of challenging work, and the work environment is friendly and easy going.
cons: Back stabbing or squeaky wheels make work life difficult. Salary doesn't keep up with private sector, and there are no incentives either financially or personally.

review_title: Growing College in need of change
pros: Strong staff union, fair pay and hours. There is a diverse mix of people staffing the college, and the faculty have tons of experience to share with the students.
cons: Many work spaces are small, but the college is growing and under construction. Not all staff are equally educated, and change is sometimes difficult due to the quantity of managers in departments.

pros: Nice facilities, great students, friendly co-workers.  Madison College provides valuable affordable education for a diverse group of students.
cons: Nearly non-existent support for Instructors.  Administrators have too many responsibilities and are stretched too thinly.  Blackboard technology is cumbersome and is a source of frustration for faculty and students alike.

pros: The overall mission to provide workplace-oriented training to students from all backgrounds and incomes is good. The individual employees are hard-working and qualified.
cons: There is a huge discrepancy between the salaries of full-time employees and the pay for part-time employees, and the college depends too much on part-time employees. There is a culture of isolation.

review_title: Great support, opportunities for growth and innovation, great team atmosphere
pros: The college provides high quality educational opportunities for tens of thousands of students. It is a pillar in the community and boasts approximately 85% of graduates working in the community as well. In addition, the college transfers more students to UW-Madison than any other institution.
cons: Could use more administrative support.

pros: Wonderful people and students, good pay, good resources. Really enjoyed the experience very much
cons: My classes were cancelled at the last minute repeatedly; I never knew whether I would be working  next semester until it was too late to plan anything else.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Madison, WI
pros: Good support and technology. Good support staff. The facilities were reasonable. The classrooms were modern. The WIFI was fast.
cons: The students are low rent and do not put forth any effort into their education. The night school students are the worse. Not a lot of mentoring help.

pros: Sometimes you can have a great boss but most of the time not especially in IT.  Use to have great benefits and cost of living adjustment.
cons: Total disregard to your contributions.  You are discounted and left feeling like a worker and not a contributing assets.  Low paying with expensive benefits cost.

review_title: Toxic environment, bullying coming from the top
pros: Excellent pay, benefits, and flexible work schedule.
cons: Fear-based environment. The two men at the top who currently have the most power use bullying, intimidation, humiliation, and aggressive behavior as their leadership style. Nobody feels safe to report it.  It has created the worst environment we've ever had.

review_title: You have to love teaching to stay motivated.
pros: Love teaching.  Some of the students are excellent to work with.
cons: Administration does not appreciate part-time staff, including some of the full-time instructors I work with.  Instead of a student-focus goal of providing quality instruction from a team-based perspective, there is a consistent reinforcement of part-timers are there to fill empty spaces and are easily replaceable.

pros: This position allowed very flexible hours and I was able to work alongside teachers. They paid higher than minimum wage.
cons: I wasn't happy that the Learning Center was located in the library because it is necessary to talk as a tutor and the library staff discourages that. However, there is now a separate tutoring center.

job_title: Adult Education Teacher in Madison, WI
pros: Teaching to all ages of students. Nice newer facilities. Able to design classes, flexibility.
cons: Difficult & cumbersome application process for positions. Lack of continuity for teaching opportunities from semester to semester.

review_title: I had a good experience working for Madison Area Technical College
pros: Everyone was very friendly and easy to work with. The pay was also decent, and they were very flexible with my school schedule.
cons: It wasn't always the most organized and they didn't always have jobs for me to do during my hours there.

pros: Good pay and benefits. Wisconsin Retirement System is the best in the world.
cons: Lack of collegiality. Upper management not very supportive to someone new coming to the institution. Too many employees seem to have one eye over their shoulder in order to protect themselves.

job_title: Orientation Coordinator in Beaver Dam, WI
pros: Regardless of the campus you are working at, it is a safe and comfortable school to work at. The payment was fair as well, and sometimes exceed research assistant's income at the University in Madison.
cons: Can be a bit boring because it is a school, not a business.

pros: Wonderful organization with an excellent sense of mission. as one of my bosses pointed out w/r/t MATC's students, "everyone who walks through that door is here to improve themselves."
cons: You are left a bit to your own devices which can be disconserting at times.

job_title: Human Resources Manager in Madison, WI
pros: They are  very engaged and diverse group, very willing to assist students figure out their way through  the maze of  available courses and appropriate to take for their majors.
cons: Nothing negative to share about our advisors.

pros: Found a student job very quickly! The professor I worked for was friendly and helpful, pay was decent, flexible hours.
cons: I can't think of any, it was just a part-time student job for the one semester I was there.

pros:
- Great work environment
- Friendly and helpful professors
cons:
- Atrocious pay
- Incredibly political at times
- Administrative staff (Laboratory Management) operates with little oversight

pros: The people who work here really care about what they are doing. The faculty, staff, and students are all amazing.
cons: Management seems to like to implement new processes constantly!

pros: Good working environment and caring management.
cons: It takes too much time to receive feedback from management on certain work tasks.

job_title: Academic Success Coach in Madison, WI
pros: Opportunities for growth, collaborative team environment, ability to make a difference in supporting student needs
cons: I have no negatives from my employment at Madison College.

pros: Great co-workers. We all work hard to make our students successful.
cons: Limited advancement opportunities for most people.

pros: The college has a model of success in place so most employees can be successful.
cons: Although the college administrators speak of diversity and equity for all employees the reality is that if you are a non-white employee with talent you wont be appreciated and your upward mobility will not exist.

pros: Access to equipment, Flexible schedule
cons: Low pay, no benefits, no job security

review_title: Trying to do to much with too little.
pros: Ability to transfer amongst staff union positions.
cons: Rigid schedule, lack of flexibility, skewed management to staff ratio in non-academic positions.

pros:
Good work life balance
Nice knowledge exposure
cons:
Salary
work from home option is not available

job_title: Student Lab Assistant in Madison, WI
pros:
-flexible schedule 
-easy work
cons: -won't give you more than 20 hours if you are a student

pros:
Intelligent, interesting co-workers and supervisors
Continuing Education/training 
Encourages creative and independent thinking
cons: Parking can be a hassle

pros: friendly staff, easy job, pays well, regular free food and drinks
cons: no cons, everything is good

pros: Meeting and helping lost students
cons: Aggressive and emotional students that didn't want to sign in

pros: It's a great place to work.
cons: I can't say a bad thing about it.

job_title: Cooking Classroom Assistant in Madison, WI
pros: New kitchens were great to work in.
cons: Limited number of shifts each week.

pros: Good benefits, coworkers are helpful
cons: Work can be repetitive and tedious
